description:

name: Chickpea Flour (Boot Beshon)
description:
Chickpea Flour (known as Boot Beshon in South Asia) is a fine, pale yellow flour made from ground chickpeas (garbanzo beans). It is a staple in many cuisines, particularly in Indian, Middle Eastern, and Mediterranean cooking. Chickpea ""Chickpea Flour (known as Boot Beshon in South Asia) is a fine, pale yellow flour made from ground chickpeas (garbanzo beans). It is a staple in many cuisines, particularly in Indian, Middle Eastern, and Mediterranean cooking. Chickpea flour is naturally gluten-free and high in protein, making it a popular alternative to wheat flour in various dishes. It is used in both savory and sweet recipes and is a key ingredient in many traditional recipes like pakoras, bhajis, and besan laddus. Uses: Batter for Frying, Curries and Dishes, Pancakes and Flatbreads, Sweets, Baking:Coating. Benefits:Rich in Protein: Chickpea flour is an excellent source of plant-based protein, making it an ideal ingredient for vegetarians and vegans.High in Fiber: It aids in digestion and helps regulate blood sugar levels.Supports Heart Health: The fiber, along with the presence of healthy fats, helps in lowering bad cholesterol levels and supporting heart health.Gluten-Free: A suitable alternative for those who are gluten intolerant or have celiac disease.Rich in Nutrients: Chickpea flour contains important vitamins and minerals, including iron, magnesium, and B-vitamins, which contribute to overall health.Naturally gluten-free and high in protein, making it a popular alternative to wheat flour in various dishes. It is used in both savory and sweet recipes and is a key ingredient in many traditional recipes like pakoras, bhajis, and besan laddus. Uses: Batter for Frying, Curries and Dishes, Pancakes and Flatbreads, Sweets, Baking, Coating. Benefits:Rich in Protein: Chickpea flour is an excellent source of plant-based protein, making it an ideal ingredient for vegetarians and vegans.High in Fiber: It aids in digestion and helps regulate blood sugar levels.Supports Heart Health: The fiber, along with the presence of healthy fats, helps in lowering bad cholesterol levels and supporting heart health.Gluten-Free: A suitable alternative for those who are gluten intolerant or have celiac disease.Rich in Nutrients: Chickpea flour contains important vitamins and minerals, including iron, magnesium, and B-vitamins, which contribute to overall health.

description:

name: ACI Nutrilife Multigrain Flour (Atta)
description:
ACI Pure Nutrilife Multigrain Atta - the perfect breakfast item that provides nourishment for people of all ages. This new variant is designed to satisfy the unique needs of customers who value quality and nutrition. It is an integrated mix of six different grains - wheat, soya, chickpea, oat, maize, and psyllium husk - which gives a healthy option for consumers. ACI Pure Nutrilife Multigrain Atta is an excellent source of vitamins that are vital in strengthening immunity and extra protein to improve body strength. The extra fiber makes food easier to digest, while the low content of saturated fat keeps your heart smiling.

name: Ifad Flour (Atta)
description:
Ifad Flour (Atta) is a premium quality whole wheat flour that serves as a staple in every kitchen. Made from the finest grains, it retains essential nutrients and fiber, making it an excellent choice for healthier cooking and baking. Perfect for making soft chapatis, rotis, and a variety of baked goods, Ifad Flour delivers exceptional taste and texture in every dish. Its fine grind ensures easy mixing and kneading, providing consistent results for your favorite recipes. Whether you're preparing traditional meals or experimenting with new cuisines, Ifad Flour is your go-to ingredient for delicious and wholesome creations.

name: Bashundhara Brown Flour (Lal Atta)
description:
Bashundhara Brown Flour, also known as Lal Atta, is a type of whole wheat flour that is commonly used in South Asian cuisine. It is made from grinding whole wheat grains, including the bran, germ, and endosperm, which gives it a brown color and a slightly coarser texture compared to refined wheat flour.

name: ACI Pure Corn Flour
description:
ACI Pure Corn Flour (150 gm) is a versatile kitchen ingredient made from finely ground corn kernels. It's a staple in many households and is commonly used for baking, cooking, and frying to add texture to various dishes, such as gravies, soups, and batters. Ingredients: This product contains pure corn flour​. Uses: It can be used to thicken sauces, make dough for frying, or create baked goods like cakes, biscuits, and pancakes​.

name: Pusti Flour (Atta)
description:
PUSTI Atta’ is a flagship premium brand in flour market of Bangladesh. Using state-of-the-art Swiss technology the product is produced by roller-milling the whole wheat grain and sieving off the bran. This is a strong flour which retains a substantial proportion of wheat’s nutrients with a protein level of 15% or higher, although much of the dietary fiber is lost by removing the bran. For production we procure quality wheat from Canada, Australia and Russia. Has a creamy color, is more flavorsome and has a stronger texture than other white flours. ‘PUSTI Atta’ is an all purpose perfect flour suitable for most everyday cooking needs.

name: Muskan White Flour (Maida)
description:
Muskan White Flour (Maida) is a finely milled, refined wheat flour, known for its smooth texture and versatility in cooking and baking. Making Process:High-quality wheat grains are selected and thoroughly cleaned.The grains are finely milled and processed to remove the bran and germ, leaving pure white flour.Packaged under hygienic conditions to ensure freshness and quality. Uses: Baking, Cooking, Thickening, Frying. Benefits:Versatile Ingredient: Suitable for a variety of dishes.Smooth Texture: Ensures soft and fluffy baked goods.Convenience: Readily available and easy to use.Note: Consume in moderation as it is a refined product with low fiber content.

name: Uncle Barn's Tempura Flour
description:
This product is manufactured/packaged in India and its raw materials are collected from Thailand. Tempura flour is normally a mix of several flours, like wheat, rice, and tapioca starch with some salt, baking powders, and pepper. Sometimes also some MSG as a taste enhancer. Mix with very cold water to make your batter. Brief content is visible, double tap to read the full content.
